maml:description.maml:para: DNS resolver.
The Get-Dns cmdlet can be used to resolve DNS names.
Append a DNS Suffix Search List to the query even if the name appears to be fully qualified.
The serial number for an Incremental Zone Transfer (IXFR).
Execute an Interative Query.
A DNS record or node name
Do not request recursion for this query.
Execute a query against all name servers for the zone.
Destination port.
DNS Record Class. Get-Dns currently only uses the IN class.
Record type, values defined by the DnsShell.RecordType enumeration.
A DNS suffix search list.
Specify the ServerName to operate on.
Use TCP.
Timeout in seconds for each query, permissible range is 1 to 30 seconds.
Request a Zone Transfer (AXFR or IXFR).

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sends a request for ANY record in the example.com.
Shows resolution of the requested name from the Root servers
Shows resolution of the name servers for the reverse lookup zone via root hints.
Shows resolution of the reverse lookup zone for a private IP range via root hints ending at prisoner.iana.org.
Request a zone transfer of example.com from the specified server.
Request an incremental zone transfer of example.com from the specified server starting with serial number 3.

maml:description.maml:para: Clear the DNS Cache on the specified server
Clear-DnsCache uses the WMI class MicrosoftDNS_Cache to clear the DNS Cache on the specified server. This CmdLet does not generate any output.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clears the DNS cache on the specified server(s).
Clears the DNS cache on the specified server(s) using the requested credential.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns DNS Records using the MicrosoftDNS WMI namespace.
Get-DnsRecord returns DNS Records from the specified server.
Only return records from the DNS Cache.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
A WQL based filter string. By default the filter exclues Root Hints and Cached records. If * is used a wildcard it will be replaced with %.
A regular expression used to match a record name.
Record type, values defined by the DnsShell.WmiRecordType enumeration.
Only return Root Hints.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.
A zone name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: List the A records matching computername in all zones on the local system.

maml:description.maml:para: Return settings from the specified DNS server.
Get-DnsServer uses MicrosoftDNS_Server and Win32_Registry to return the full set of DNS Server settings.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.
Returns settings for a Zone.
Get-DnsZone uses MicrosoftDNS_Zone to return the full set of DNS Zone settings.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
A WQL based filter string.
A zone name.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clears the DNS cache on the specified server(s).

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new DNS Record.
New-DnsRecord creates a DNS record using the record type classes in WMI and the CreateInstanceFromPropertyData method.
Cache timeout in seconds for WINS lookups. Used for creation of WINS and WINSR records.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
The CPU of the host. One of CPU or OS must be supplied for creation of HINFO record.
Error Mailbox name. Required for creation of MINFO records.
The hostname the record refers to. Required for creation of CNAME, MB, MD, MF, NS and PTR records.
Specify new IP Address. Required for creation of A, AAAA and WKS records.
Specify new IP Address. Required for creation of A, AAAA and WKS records.
The ISDN Number. Required for creation of ISDN records.
The lookup timeout in seconds applied when forwarding to WINS. Used for creation of WINS and WINSR records.
Mailbox Name. Required for creation of MG and MR records.
WINS Mapping Flag, determines whether the record is replicated or not. Used for creation fo WINS and WINSR records. By default records are replicated.
The name of the record to create relative to the zone. If blank or @ the zone name will be used.
The Operating System of the host. One of CPU or OS must be supplied for creation of HINFO record.
By default New-DnsRecord does not return any output. Adding the PassThru parameter will cause New-DnsRecord to return a representation of the new record.
Port number. Required for creation of SRV records.
Record preference. Required for creation of MX and RT records.
Record priority. Optional value when creating SRV records.
PSDN Address. Required for creation of X25 records.
The record type to create, where permissible record types are defined by the DnsShell.WmiRecordType enumeration.
Responsible Mailbox. Required for creation of MINFO and RP records.
WINSR result domain. Required for creation of WINSR records.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.
A list of service names. Required for creation of WKS records.
The sub-address of an ISDN number. Optional value when creating ISDN records.
AFSDB Sub-type. Required for creation of AFSDB records.
Target host name. Required for creation of AFSDB, MX and SRV records.
A text string. Required for creation of TXT records.
The record TTL. If not specified the record will inherit the minimum TTL configured in the SOA record for the zone.
TXT Domain Name. Required for creation of RP records.
Relative record weight. Optional value when creating SRV records.
WINS server list. Required for creation of WINS records.
The new record will be created within the specified zone.
Creates a DNS Zone.
New-DnsZone creates a DNS Zone using the WMI class MicrosoftDNS_Zone and the CreateZone method.
The zone file name.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
The zone file name.
The Master Server list required when created a Secondary, Stub or Conditional Forwarder zones.
By default New-DnsRecord does not return any output. Adding the PassThru parameter will cause New-DnsRecord to return a representation of the new record.
Responsible Person to be used in the SOA Record.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.
The zone name.
Zone Type as defined in DnsShell.ZoneType enumeration.
Forces a Secondary Zone to refresh or a Primary Zone to reload.
Update-DnsZone calls the UpdateFromDS method on an AD Integrated Primary Zone, ReloadZone on a Standard Primary or ForceRefresh on a Secondary zone.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
WMI Management Path used to identify the zone. Accepts Identity Property returned by Get-DnsZone.
Specify the ServerName to operate on.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Forces the Secondary zone example.com to refresh.

maml:description.maml:para: Delete a DNS object.
Deletes a the DNS object specified by the Identity (Management Path) and server.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
Bypass confirmation request.
WMI Management Path used to identify the object. Accepts Identity Property returned by Get-DnsRecord or Get-DnsZone.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.
Resumes a paused DNS zone.
Resume-DnsZone calls the ResumeZone method on an instance of MicrosoftDNS_Zone.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
WMI Management Path used to identify the zone. Accepts Identity Property returned by Get-DnsZone.
Specify the ServerName to operate on.
Starts the Scavenging process on the specified server.
Start-DnsScavenging calls the StartScavenging method on MicrosoftDNS_Server. This CmdLet does not generate any output.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Starts the scavenging process on server.example.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts the DNS Service on the specified server.
Start-DnsService calls the StartService method on MicrosoftDNS_Server. This CmdLet does not generate any output.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Starts the DNS service on server.example.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops the DNS Service on the specified server.
Stop-DnsService calls the StopService method on MicrosoftDNS_Server. This CmdLet does not generate any output.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Stops the DNS service on server.example.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Pauses a running DNS zone.
Suspend-DnsZone calls the PauseZone method on an instance of MicrosoftDNS_Zone.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
WMI Management Path used to identify the zone. Accepts Identity Property returned by Get-DnsZone.
Specify the ServerName to operate on.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Pauses the example.com zone on localhost.

maml:description.maml:para: Update a DNS zone file from running zone.
Update-DnsZoneFile calls the WriteBackZone method on an instance of MicrosoftDNS_Zone.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
WMI Management Path used to identify the zone. Accepts Identity Property returned by Get-DnsZone.
Specify the ServerName to operate on.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Writes the example.com zone held in memory back to the zone file.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns DNS Records using LDAP.
Get-ADDnsRecord returns records from Active Directory.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
Used in the LDAP filter to match a record name.
The search root, typically the distinguished name of a zone or partition.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.
Returns DNS Zones using LDAP.
Get-ADDnsZone returns zones from Active Directory.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
Used in the LDAP filter to match a zone name.
The search root, typically the distinguished name of a partition.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.
Returns partitions from Active Directory.
Get-ADDnsPartition returns partitions which may host DNS zones from Active Directory.
Specify credentials with permission to perform this action.
Specify the ServerName(s) to operate on.
